characters: MOMENTS LATER, AS THE DOOR SWINGS OPEN, REVEALING--
BACK TO FLINT AND THE MERCHANT CAPTAIN--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - A CAPTAIN'S LOG, as itвЂ™s yanked from a shelf REVEAL the Cook, as he opens the log, flips rapidly throu the pages. Looking for something. Running out of time. Finally, he finds the page he was looking for. Rips it ou rolls it up, inserts it into a SMALL LEATHER POUCH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook emerges, trying to blend in. Heads down a corrid but quickly has to take cover as heвЂ™s almost steamrolle A THRONG OF MEN emerging from the armory, carrying CUTLAS RIFLES-- The Cook hides-- Waits for them to pass... The coast clear, he emerges. And takes note of the armory and its HEAVY IRON DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook enters. ItвЂ™s empty. He exhales. But as he turn to shut the door-- ItвЂ™s stuck. He gives it a shove, but DOOR SHOVES BACK-- THE DOOR THEN BURSTS INWARD, knocking Cook on his ass. (He doesnвЂ™t notice that the MYSTERIOUS POUCH slips out of his coat, and slides under a table...) A YOUNG SAILOR enters. 20s. Handsome. He spots the Cook down on his ass. The Sailor winces regretfully...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
dialogues.text: Sorry. The Young Sailor shuts the door. Locks the deadbolt.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Why arenвЂ™t you up there with the crew?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
dialogues.text: I think the better question is, why arenвЂ™t they all down here with us? You could get killed up there... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: So youвЂ™re a coward then?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
dialogues.text: Yes. You too?

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m no coward! IвЂ™m a cook, I have no station to man. What do you think this crew will do when they find out you abandoned yours?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
dialogues.text: Well if theyвЂ™re dead, and IвЂ™m still alive... IвЂ™11 like my chances. Suddenly, the noises from above stop. Eerie silence. The Cook then turns back to the Sailor, and grins a nasty gri

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: If you fight, at least your death will be a quick one... (off the SailorвЂ™s look) When the pirates take this ship, and find you down here... They will show you immeasurable cruelty.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
dialogues.text: Torture...? The Cook senses the sailorвЂ™s fear, runs with it.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: Do you not know who that is out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our first good look at the Pirate Ship, closing in... Menacing... We get a clear look at itвЂ™s BLACK PENNANT--

dialogues.speaker: COOK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That ship flies the banner of Captain Flint... And we then PULL BACK TO REVEAL weвЂ™re on the deck of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where itвЂ™s deserted. Not a soul above deck. Except for FIRST MATE, standing by the door of the QUARTERDECK CABIN makeshift bunker at the stern of the ship.) Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: COOK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A monster so violent and cruel, itвЂ™s said even Blackbeard himself shudders at his mention... The Mate watches as the Pirate Ship closes in... A PIRATE SNIPER takes a potshot at the Mate-- Misses by inches. Th Mate recoils. Realizes heвЂ™s out of time... He makes the of the cross, then enters the bunker, and SLAMS THE DOOR-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook and Sailor, alone in the armory.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: And his crew... Bloodthirsty savages, eager and willing to do his bidding...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
dialogues.text: (beat) Isn't this your problem, too?

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: Good cooks are in short supply. Even for criminals. TheyвЂ™ll take me in. But you... cowering below decks to dodge a fight? They'll gut you for sport. The Sailor considers that a moment. Then--

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know... IвЂ™m one of those people thatвЂ™s hard to dislike... On the Cook, getting frustrated. The moment is broken by sound of MULTIPLE THUDS up above... Off Cook and Sailor--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAPPLING HOOKS FLY OVER THE BULWARKS of the Merchant Shi landing on the deck with a SERIES OF THUDS, before being pulled tight... Straining... Pulling us closer to the Pirate Ship... PULL BACK TO REVEAL WEвЂ™RE IN-- THE QUARTERDECK BUNKER, looking out through a small LOOPH ItвЂ™s cramped in here. Dark. Merchant Sailors (including First Mate) peer out of the loopholes, RIFLES at the read ON THE MERCHANT CAPTAIN, at the rear of the crowded bunke Nervous. Waiting. Listening to the sounds of the GRAPPLIN ROPES straining, as his ship is hauled in by the Pirates. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Around him, SAILORS hold cutlasses, axes... In case the bunker is breached.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: Collision up! And as the Pirate Ship finally SLAMS INTO THE MERCHANT SH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook and Sailor are thrown to the ground from the collision... As they fall, we see THE LEATHER POUCH slide of his hiding place, into the open. Meanwhile--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sailors right themselves, resume their positions by t loopholes-- Peer out to see-- PIRATES-- Swarming onto the deck-- Among them, their PIRA CAPTAIN, identifiable even at this distance by the way he confidently directs and positions his men...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... ThatвЂ™s him isnвЂ™t it?

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Fire! The Gunmen FIRE their muskets through the loopholes. But Pirates respond... Throwing SMOKE GRENADES onto the Merch Ship deck... Quickly, THE DECK IS COVERED IN A HAZE OF SMOKE. The Pirates disappear into it. And all goes silent The Merchant Captain stares out into the smoke. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Powder boxes. On my command. By his feet, a RUNNER nods, before ducking down a ladder THE SUB DECK, where the Runner silently SIGNALS another SAILOR, stationed down a narrow corridor... Then ANOTHER. Until the silent message finally reaches-- A GALLEY FULL OF TRIGGER MEN... A DOZEN OR SO, spaced out the dark. Lit only by the faint flame from their HOT IRON Each stands by a FUSE dangling from the ceiling... Leadin to BOOBY TRAPS on the deck above... BACK IN THE BUNKER, with the Captain, as he peers out int the silent smoky haze. Listening. Waiting for some signal as to the pirates position... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come closer, bastards... The silence persists. The tension builds. And we GO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the Cook and the Sailor are dusting themselves off, ship quiet for the moment. The Cook notices, however, tha the Sailor is HOLDING THE MYSTERIOUS POUCH he dropped...

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: Give me that...

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s nothing. Give it to me! The Cook SNATCHES THE POUCH from the SailorвЂ™s hand, stu it back into his coat. The Sailor, being no dummy--

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: DoesnвЂ™t seem like nothing. Maybe when Mr. Flint gets here, he can decide if itвЂ™s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: (beat; icily...) You wouldnвЂ™t want to do that...

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: No? Why not? The Cook pulls a CUTLASS off a rack, with a loud SCCRRRRI

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. And as the Cook takes a HACK AT THE SAILOR, we CUT BACK T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK with the Trigger Men, irons at the ready. Above, the can hear the faint sound of FOOTFALLS. CREAKS in the wood The pirates are right above us... From up the corridor, the SILENT SIGNAL arrives-- The

dialogues.speaker: TRIGGER MEN LIGHT THEIR FUSES--
dialogues.text: BACK IN THE BUNKER, the Captain waiting for the sound of exploding pirates... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 But there is no bang. No nothing. Just silence. The Captain turns to the Runner by his feet--

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: I told you to fire the mines!

dialogues.speaker: RUNNER
dialogues.text: We did, sir. On the Captain... Starting to get that sinking feeling...

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: How did he do that...?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: Sir. We may still have time--

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Those mines were hidden. Proofed against tampering. A dozen of them.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: Sir, if we do not surrender now, Flint will kill us all--! The Captain quickly produces a PISTOL-- POINTS IT IN THE MATEвЂ™S FACE. A tense beat. Things getting out of hand, rapidly... But the moment is broken by-- A FAINT KABOOM of a cannon firing in the distance... Foll quickly by a loud CRACK of impact. Then SILENCE. Looks exchanged-- What the hell was that? The Men all crowd up the LOOPHOLES... Peer out... And then they hear-- A DEEP, HORRIBLE GROAN... Like from some kind of monster. Goosebumps all around the bunker. The Captain then sees something out in the smoke... He in closer to his portal to get a better look... Just in time see something coming this way... SOMETHING HUGE... THE GROAN CRESCENDOES. The CaptainвЂ™s eyes go wide... He SPRINGS FOR COVER just as-- THE SHIPвЂ™S MAINMAST CRASHES INTO THE BUNKER-- Shatterin reinforced walls and roof-- IN THE MERCHANT CAPTAINвЂ™S POV... Blinded by the light p though the gaping hole in his bunker... his EARS RINGING THE SHOCK OF THE COLLAPSE... He watches as-- PIRATES storm through the opening, emerging out of the smoke... And as SWORDS BEGIN TO CLANG TOGETHER IN ANGER-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the Sailor, winded, as he dodges another CUTLASS SWI

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: Look, I get it. Whatever you've got there, itвЂ™s obviously very valuable.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: You canвЂ™t even imagine-- The Cook swings again, forcing the Sailor to duck.

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: Hey-- LetвЂ™s be reasonable. WhatвЂ™s say I donвЂ™t breathe a word of this to anyone... Deal? The Cook summons all his strength, finally tackles the Sa to the ground. The Sailor and the Cook grapple, the Cookв bulk giving him the advantage... Pinning the Sailor down.

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s too late for that now... THE COOK RAISES THE CUTLASS-- Off the SailorвЂ™s panicked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pirates and Sailors, in close quarters combat... The Merchant Captain watches, stunned... His men fighting Pirates with swords, axes, fists... Chaos... The Captain fixes on one particular Pirate. A GIANT of a man. Making quick work of defender after defender... Comi this way... The Merchant Captain is paralyzed with fear.. The Giant nears... Raises his cutlass... And just as heвЂ about to bring it down on the CaptainвЂ™s head-- CLANG! Someone deflects the GiantвЂ™s sword into a bulkhe

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL THAT SOMEONE IS--
dialogues.text: THE PIRATE CAPTAIN. FLINT. He and the Giant exchange a contentious glare with each other.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I believe weвЂ™ve made our point. (to the Merchant Captain) HavenвЂ™t we? Off the Merchant Captain, more than ready to surrender... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below deck, the fight now over. A few pirates search the belly of the ship for cargo. At their lead is an older pirate, whom weвЂ™ll later meet as GATES (60s). They reac locked door... The ARMORY. A pirate with the AXE HACKS IT OPEN, to REVEAL-- THE SAILOR, staring innocently back at him. And at the Sailor's feet, is THE COOK. Face down. Dead. With the CUTLASS STICKING UP THROUGH HIS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR
dialogues.text: He couldnвЂ™t handle the thought of what you might do to him. (then) I, on the other hand, would very much like to join your crew.

dialogues.speaker: SAILOR, (JOHN SILVER)
dialogues.text: My name is John Silver. And I happen to be a very good cook... And off JOHN SILVER, we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Merchant Captain has been tied to the mainmast. Nearb his crew (save Silver) are herded together. The GIANT we slashing his way through the bunker approaches the crew. They do their best not to cower... But then, Giant speaks

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: You have nothing to fear from him now. We are your brothers. On the Merchant Crew. They werenвЂ™t expecting that... Th Giant (whose name is SINGLETON), continues--

dialogues.speaker: GIANT, (SINGLETON)
dialogues.text: Men who work for our own survival, instead of thriving off the work of others. As are you... At this, Singleton sees Gates and Silver emerging from be This next bit is as much for GatesвЂ™s ears as anyone's.. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s the tyrant captain that is the enemy of us all. And when you cease to fear the tyrant, he canвЂ™t last for long... Gates hears that. Sees a CROWD OF PIRATES around Singleto staring back at him with hollow, angry stares. He then po Silver towards BILLY BONES (20s), the shipвЂ™s First Mate

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: This one wants to join. Says he can cook. Billy nods, as Gates enters into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where we find Flint, and DUFRESNE (20s, bookish). Dufre sits, papers and ledgers spread all around. Flint is read one of the books. He doesnвЂ™t look up as Gates enters--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: We made a full sweep of the lower holds. Twelve casks of palm oil. Eight of sugar. Some scattered tobacco, maybe a few dozen pounds.

dialogues.speaker: DUFRESNE
dialogues.text: (beat) ThatвЂ™s all? GatesвЂ™s silence affirms. Dufresne casts a concerned gla in FlintвЂ™s direction, who isnвЂ™t paying attention... D then consults his notes, does a few quick calculations...

dialogues.speaker: DUFRESNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Total tally... 400. Maybe five if we are lucky selling the tobacco. CameronвЂ™s arm is broken, and Duffy was shot in the leg. After injury payments, weвЂ™ll net just under 8 pounds per man.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: 8 pounds...? Flint glances up from his book. Unconcerned.

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The men are not going to be happy... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: When are they ever?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: When their end is a hell of a lot richer than 8 pounds... Flint smiles a bit. TouchГ©.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Here, look... Flint hands Gates the journal heвЂ™s been reading. As Gat reads, Flint talks privately to him--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: CaptainвЂ™s log. The whole story is here. Vazquez. Port Royal. (a small smile) I told you this was the ship... Gates reacts, but then flips the page in the journal back forth, as if looking for something--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: WhereвЂ™s the map?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Someone mustвЂ™ve torn it out. Minor obstacle, but weвЂ™re getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Minor obstacle... (then) Let me see if I have this straight. This is our fourth prize in a row from which our profits will just barely exceed the expense it took to win it. Singleton is out there right now getting your crew ready to torture that poor bastard of a captain, only because he hasn't figured out how to get them to do it to you yet. But itвЂ™s ok, because youвЂ™ve discovered that the secret map we canвЂ™t tell anyone we're looking for may exist on a page that we donвЂ™t have.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: (beat) ...donвЂ™t have yet. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Gates has to smile. But then, DR. HOWELL (40s, ruddy) enters. HeвЂ™s wearing a LEATHER APRON, covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOWELL
dialogues.text: Mr. Duffy is dead. That lands. GatesвЂ™s smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I removed the leg. But heвЂ™d lost too much blood. Dufresne does some quick scribbling. Then, solemnly--

dialogues.speaker: DUFRESNE
dialogues.text: Make that 9 pounds per man. A quiet beat, as the room darkens. Flint then starts to h for the door--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I just need a minute with the Captain... But Gates grabs his arm. Stops him--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s bad out there.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Their men are all restrained.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: It isnвЂ™t their men IвЂ™m worried about. Flint knows Gates is serious. Still--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: We're so close. CanвЂ™t stop now... off Gates--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gates approaches his crew. Singleton steps forward--

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: We paid a heavy toll today. And for what...? We all know the prize wonвЂ™t come close to making it worthwhile. Someone must be made to pay the difference... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Merchant Captain) Right now, heвЂ™1l have to do... This, as Singleton sees Flint approaching the mainmast. SINGLETON (CONTвЂ™D) What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Just... Give him a minute. ON FLINT, with the terrified Merchant Captain.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Where is the map?

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: The page with Vazquez's map. ItвЂ™s missing-- Do you have it? The Captain looks Flint in the eye. Silent. Flint then peeks over at Singleton and the crew. Eying the Merchant Captain like a piece of meat...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you know something, now would be the time to say so... ACROSS THE DECK, with Gates and Singleton. Privately--

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: Two captains, out of touch with their men... (then) Just so you know, I have no ill- will towards you. Once I have the votes to depose Flint, there will be a place for you on my ship...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Singleton? (off his look) Shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: I told you, I donвЂ™t have it. One of my men mustвЂ™ve taken it-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: They were searched.

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Your men, then.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: They didnвЂ™t have access. Can you remember what you wrote down?

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: I wrote it down so I wouldnвЂ™t have to remember. Dammit, if I knew more I would tell you. Now call off your men! Beat. Flint looks over at the angry pirate crew... on the Merchant Captain--

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You canвЂ™t, can you...? (sneers) You're their captain, and you have no control over them...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: You're their captain, and they just signed your death warrant. So IвЂ™m not sure either of us is ina position to criticize. 14. It dawns The Merchant Captain darkens, no longer hiding his contem

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: How long before youвЂ™re the one they tie to the mast? On Flint. Done with this guy. As he walks away--

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT CAPTAIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t give any of you the satisfaction of crying out!

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Good for you. But as Flint nears the cabin--

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: Where are you going? (Flint stops) Justice is about to be done... And you're turning your back? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Flint glares. A tense moment between them. But then--

dialogues.speaker: FRESH-FACED SAILOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sail ho! Everyone rushes to the starboard railing. Very small on t horizon is a SHIP. Someone hands Flint the spyglass...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s a ship of the line.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Royal Navy. The Scarborough.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Scarborough doesnвЂ™t patrol this far south.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: She does today. And sheвЂ™s got the wind on us. (then, to the CREW) Sails up. WeвЂ™re leaving now. The crew races to action, no questions asked.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Minor obstacle, is it? Off Flint--

dialogues.speaker: END ACT ONE
dialogues.text: Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FlintвЂ™s ship (the WALRUS) cruises on open waters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SURLY COOK in a foul apron cuts potatoes on an even fou chopping block, until he sees Silver and Billy approachin The cook stops cutting. Grumbles. Takes off his apron, an shoves it into SilverвЂ™s hands. He then sulks off, and e

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: He'll be alright. (then) First and third watch mess together, along with the Quarter- master. Captain usually with the second. And no extra rations, not for the Captain, not for anyone. Every man is an equal here. Clear? Silver nods. Billy turns to leave. Stops...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can cook, right?

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: (beat) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (beat; then, muttered--) CanвЂ™t be any worse... And Billy exits. Silver waits til heвЂ™s gone. Then PULLS THE POUCH he took from the Cook. And pulls from it-- THE MYSTERIOUS PAGE, and we finally get a look at it. Som numbers, vaguely organized into columns. Indecipherable. flips it over, hoping for more info. Nothing. Silver slumps... What the hell is this? And as we PUSH IN on the torn edge, and we DISSOLVE TO: INT. WALRUS - CAPTAINвЂ™S CABIN - DAY ...THE FRAYED EDGES OF THE CAPTAIN'S LOG, from which the was torn. And FLINT, staring into it. Almost as if he mig will it to reappear. Gates enters, and sits. Conspicuousl silent for a beat. Flint looks up slowly...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: He has the votes. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Beg pardon?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Singleton. He has the votes to remove you as Captain. (off FlintвЂ™s look) Maybe not every last one, IвЂ™m still canvassing. But once he gets ashore, where he doesnвЂ™t have to be sneaky about it, heвЂ™ll get what he needs...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I thought you said itвЂ™d never get to this.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I thought you said you put loyal men in all the right places, so that this crew would never turn--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: That was before today.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: So because of one short haul--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: One more short haul, to be fair. But thatвЂ™s not what did it.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Then what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: The Scarborough. (then) They all knew the day would come when the Empire would start paying attention to us again. What if today is that day? If weвЂ™re run out of Nassau, how long before we find a new port? How lean will things get in the meantime? Scary questions. Singleton is capitalizing. Flint considers this a long beat. Then-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: So fix it.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Fix it...?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Buy them back. Twist arms. Do... Whatever it is you do.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: That doesnвЂ™t quite feel like a solution to this particular problem.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t need a solution, I just need a few more days...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: We've been after this map for months, what makes you think all you need is a few more days?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m going to see Richard.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Richard Guthrie... You think heвЂ™s going to help you?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s, for fun, say he doesnвЂ™t. What then?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Then I will forget about the map. We'll return to hunting fat, lazy merchantmen. And everyone will be content.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: And I have your word on that? Beat. Straight face. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Of course. On Gates... Jeez... The moment is broken as Billy sticks his head in the door. A big grin on his face. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Landfall... WeвЂ™re home. off Flint and Gates, we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Walrus sails into the warm blue bay, a handful of oth PIRATE SHIPS sitting at anchor nearby. TENDER SHIPS and BARGES shuttle about, ferrying passengers and cargo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HARBOR BARGE comes ashore, and a number of pirates disembark and begin unloading cargo. Among the crowd, Sil steps forward, and takes in-- NASSAU. Its shore crowded with crudely built HUTS, TENTS LEAN-TOS. DOZENS of pirates emerge from the encampment to greet the WalrusвЂ™s crew... Overlooking this shanty-town, up on the bluff, is an IMPO STONE FORTRESS. And beyond that, we can just make out the outlines of the townвЂ™s main thoroughfare. Altogether, a filthy, noisy but picturesque tableau.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Is this English soil?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Was. Once. Now itвЂ™s ours. This, as a TRIO of giggling WHORES burst onto the beach, passing out RUM, bread and fruit. One of them leaps into Logan's arms, buries his face in her breasts... when he finally comes up for air...

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice, inвЂ™it? This, as A BOTTLE OF RUM is thrust into SilverвЂ™s hands. MUSIC starts up, and the scene turns festive. Off Silver, canвЂ™t quite believe his luck. As he takes a drink-- MEANWHILE... We find GATES, walking with Billy up the bea towards a small SKIFF anchored just off the sand.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t understand... The Captain asked for me to go along with him?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: No, but I have business here, so the job falls to you. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: And what is the job, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: The Captain is going to ask Richard for a favor. Richard is going to say no. When that happens, the Captain will, most likely, react poorly. When that happens, I need you to restrain him. Billy stops dead in his tracks. It takes Gates a few step before he realizes. Doubles back to Billy...

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No cargo moves off this island without Mr. GuthrieвЂ™s ships and connections. He is not someone we need to be making an enemy of.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (a very long beat) Restrain him, you say...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: (pat on the shoulder) IвЂ™m sure you'll do fine. Gates heads towards the skiff, Billy following reluctantl

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™1l never listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Nonsense. YouвЂ™re an indispensable part of this crew, and I assure you, the Captain appreciates that more than you know. --this as they arrive at the skiff. Gates addresses Flint

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: BillyвЂ™s going with you.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Who's Billy? Beat. Gates slow-turns to Billy. And off their look, we g BACK TO THE MAIN BEACH, where Silver is helping to unload cargo. Nearby, two CREWMEN grouse-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: WALRUS CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: What do you think our shares come to? I heard twenty...

dialogues.speaker: WALRUS CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: Twenty? Singleton says we'll be lucky to see five. Over this, we notice-- Silver has stopped unloading. He's staring into a BASKET of goods from the ship. Fixed on something at the bottom of it we canвЂ™t yet see... He reaches in, and pulls out-- A BOOK. THEN ANOTHER. A handful of journals of varying sizes. Silver looks around. Makes sure no one is watching him... Carefully selects THREE BOOKS that are the same size as h MYSTERIOUS TORN-OUT PAGE... He opens one. On the first page: Captain's Log -- Vol.1. Silver compares the mystery page-- THE HANDWRITING MATCHE He then quickly flips through the book. But it doesnвЂ™t appear to be missing a page. Opens the next book. Flips. Nothing missing there either. Ditto, the third one. But h notes that the books are labelled Vols. 1, 2 and 4. THERE ONE MISSING. Off Silver, getting closer to an answer-- MOMENTS LATER, we find Dufresne, hunched over a makeshift table, recording cargo as its unloaded in a ledger...

dialogues.speaker: DUFRESNE
dialogues.text: A cook book? REVERSE, and REVEAL SILVER, standing there talking to him

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s absurd, I know. I left it with our Captain for safe-keeping but I donвЂ™t see it with the rest of his journals--

dialogues.speaker: DUFRESNE
dialogues.text: Everything from the captainвЂ™s quarters is here. If what youвЂ™re looking for isnвЂ™t, Flint must have kept it. (then) The Captain likes his books. Dufresne goes back to work. And Silver turns. Looks out t the Walrus, anchored out in the bay. Somehow, heвЂ™s gonn have to get back out there... But breaking the moment-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Which oneвЂ™s the new one? Silver looks over as a GAUNT, DEAD-EYED MAN is approachin him. Not from our crew. Logan steps in front of Silver--

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Is this really necessary? HeвЂ™s just a cook...

dialogues.speaker: GAUNT MAN
dialogues.text: He meets the new ones. No exceptions. Logan turns back to Silver, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry, mate...

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s going on? Who wants to meet me?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (ominously) Blackbeard. Off Silver, starting to worry, we SMASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smoky whorehouse. The Gaunt Man leads Silver through th parlor, as Logan and a few other Crewmen tag along for mo support. The Gaunt Man then stops at a set of DOUBLE DOOR

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Whatever you do... DonвЂ™t show fear. On Silver. Totally at a loss. The Gaunt Man opens the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s dark. Lit by a few dim LANTERNS. Silver enters, tu to see several SILHOUETTED figures in the back. The lante turn up... Revealing-- FIVE NAKED WHORES, draped around a large ornate chair. In chair is a FIGURE, his face obscured under a hat. Blackbe But the figure then lifts its head, revealing... A BEAUTI BLACK HAIRED WHORE, naked beneath a thin velvet robe.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: You're not Blackbeard... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 The WHORE smiles, then slowly opens her robe, revealing a large patch of unruly black PUBIC HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see. Silver turns to see his Walrus buddies laughing at him.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t fall in now, you hear? They shut the door behind him. Off Silver, we HARD CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes being torn off Silver's body by multiple hands...

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Alright, easy now... But the whores arenвЂ™t listening. Just as Silver is abou give in, his pants are torn off, and he remembers-- THE LEATHER POUCH, which falls to the floor as his pants tossed on a chair. SilverвЂ™s eyes go wide. He makes a mo to recover it, but the nearest whore (MAX, 20s, mulatto), puts a hand on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (French creole accent) Rules are rules. And you are ours. She shoves him back down to the bed, and the orgy begins. But even now, Silver canвЂ™t help but glance over at the LEATHER POUCH... Off it, DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with drunk pirates, as Gates enters, makes his way through... As he goes, we pick up SNIPPETS of conversatio The word вЂњScarboroughвЂќ on everyone's lips. Gates also Singleton, talking intently with an older BLACK PIRATE. Gates moves to the bar, addresses the BARTENDER (MR. SCOT 50s, black).

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Need a moment with your boss. Scott nods to a closed DOOR behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SCOTT
dialogues.text: Not a good time. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 This, as the back room door FLIES OPEN, and an ANGRY PIRA CAPTAIN storms out, followed by a YOUNG WOMAN (mid-20s, beautiful, but with an edge). TheyвЂ™re in mid-argument.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: You want to run at first sight of trouble, be my guest. But donвЂ™t expect me to fucking help you. As the PIRATE storms off, the woman realizes the entire b has grown quiet. All eyes on her. YOUNG WOMAN (CONTвЂ™D) (to the bar) That goes for all of you. If you want stay and hunt, my doorвЂ™s open. If the mere whiff of the navy is too much for you, then God bless, and get the fuck out. Muttering and such, as everyone goes back to their drinki

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: ...-Madame Guthrie?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you want? She turns, and sees its Gates asking for her. Off ELEANOR GUTHRIE, proprietor of this place, WE GO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Gates, as he follows the Guthrie back into the offic Scott joins them, shuts the door--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: I see words travels fast.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Yellow bastard wanted 40 barrels of powder, thatвЂ™s half what I have. All so he can head south and never come back. She trades a look with Scott, who shakes his head in disbelief. Gates waits patiently, as Guthrie looks his wa

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what do you want? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Word is you idiots barely cleared enough from this last prize to cover the cost of taking her.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: We have an agitator. (off their looks) No business being a captain, but heвЂ™s capitalizing on FlintвЂ™s recent... rough patch. I expect him to call a vote soon, and I expect that vote to be a close one. On Guthrie, as that lands. SheвЂ™s intrigued...

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: FlintвЂ™s got morale problems, what do you want me to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: I need money. To shore up support.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: (confused) So get Dufresne in here with the tally, IвЂ™1l float you an advance on your last haul--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: It wonвЂ™t be enough. scott (incredulous) You want a loan? Gates knows heвЂ™s crossing a line here, but he pushes on

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: FlintвЂ™s made you more money than any other captain here-- sScoTtT Not lately, he hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: That will change. Once I get the crew under control, we go back to hunting the big fish. I have his word on that. Think of it as an investment. A little money now, big money later. (then; to Guthrie) But make no mistake; (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: without that money, the man who helped you build this operation is out of a job tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SCOTT
dialogues.text: You steal cargo at the end of a sword. We sell that cargo to markets that would never have you. When you are strong, you are a necessary evil. When you are not strong, you are likely soon to be dead. What you are not, ever, is a sound investment--

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: How much would you need? Both Scott and Gates seem equally surprised by that.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: A thousand pounds. Give or take. Guthrie considers him evenly. She then goes to her desk. Writes out a note on parchment. Seals it.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Take this to Virgil. HeвЂ™ll see that you get it. Gates is wary. That was way too easy. But heвЂ™1ll take i

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Thank you, maвЂ™am. He takes the parchment, makes a hasty exit. As the door shuts, Scott turns to Guthrie, shoots her a look--

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SCOTT
dialogues.text: You just put a thousand pounds of our money behind a lost cause. Guthrie doesnвЂ™t want to hear it. She crosses to the win looks out at the bustling town... The sea beyond it--

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: When this place was a smoking wreck after the Santa Teresa, and no one wanted any part of it... Flint planted his flag here. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: MR. SCOTT
dialogues.text: What would your father have to say about that?

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™d say I just put a thousand pounds of his money behind a lost cause. (then) But heвЂ™s not here, is he? Off Scott--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An idyllic strip of land. White sand beaches. Calm harbor Charming little coastal settlement. ItвЂ™s only about 40 from Nassau, but itвЂ™s light-years more civilized... Off the CLANG-CLANG-CLANG OF A LOUD BRASS DOOR KNOCKER... EXT. HARBOUR ISLAND - RICHARDвЂ™S HOUSE - DAY Flint and Billy, waiting outside the front door of a sprawling plantation house. Flint notices Billy fidgeting with his hair, trying to spit down a stubborn cowlick. Fl watches him for a long beat. Billy realizes--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Sorry. IвЂ™ve just never actually met the man before. (then) How should I address him?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I would prefer that you didnвЂ™t. Billy shrinks, scolded. The door opens, answered by A VAL

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Smith, to see Mr. Guthrie. He isnвЂ™t expecting me. Off Flint-- INT. RICHARDвЂ™S HOUSE - FOYER - DAY The home of one of the wealthier men in the Bahamas. The paintings alone are worth a fortune. Flint notices Billy one in particular; a GENERAL ON HORSEBACK. Noble. Heroic.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Oliver Cromwell. (then) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I doubt anyone ever made him take a chaperone to a meeting. Billy looks back. A bit terrified. Flint consider him.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s does the crew think of me, Billy?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Beg your pardon, sir?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a simple question. YouвЂ™re first mate, you hear whatвЂ™s said... Billy hesitates, unsure how to answer--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know theyвЂ™ve always found me aloof. Too well-educated. But now it seems they feel IвЂ™m too--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: --weak. Beat. BillyвЂ™s a little stunned he said that out loud. On Billy.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I was going to say unlucky. (off BillyвЂ™s look) So thatвЂ™s the thinking... We've been attacking ships with light loads because IвЂ™m too weak to do otherwise. Instantly regretting opening his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that what you think? Now BillyвЂ™s really on the spot. But before he can answe

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here? Enter RICHARD GUTHRIE (50s; wealthy and soft), coming up hall from a set of french doors leading to a back patio..

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: What kind of a way is that to welcome a friend...? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Flint then notices, through the french doors, a FAT OLD B MAN, being attended to by a pair of HOT GIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would much prefer that way. Richard flags his valet to close the doors.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: A sugar merchant. From Boston. Who purchases your plunder from me, but would be far less likely to do so if he had to acknowledge your part in supplying it. (beat) Now what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s something you and I need to discuss. Behind closed doors, preferably...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILVER STARTS AWAKE. The room is quiet now. A STEAMING TI CUP is put in front of his face. ItвЂ™s being held by Max

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: CвЂ™est le cafe. EveryoneвЂ™s drinking it in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: That doesnвЂ™t sound like much of a recommendation... Silver gets up, starts getting dressed. Until he realizes that his POCKETS ARE EMPTY. He searches frantically, befo looking up to Max and seeing-- SHEвЂ™S HOLDING THE POUCH.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: A whore for every finger on your hand... But your eyes kept drifting to this. Tell me... What is it that is so valuable to you? Silver takes a step toward her, but she remains calm.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One scream will bring Mr. Noonan.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Bring him. I can let him know his whores steal from their customers. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: And he can let your new captain know you've withheld something of great value that rightly belonged to his latest prize... Silver stops. Fuck... She's got him.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: So what now?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: This is to sell, is it not? But you cannot know who best to sell it to here... I could know that.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: And what's that going to cost me?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Half.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Fuck you--

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Pleasure should be shared equally. It is the only way to avoid hurt feelings... On Silver. HeвЂ™s got no choice, and he knows it. He nods submitting...

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excellent. Now. Tell me what it is.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. (off her look) I know itвЂ™s torn from a book that belonged to my old Captain. Some kind of schedule, maybe. But until I can get my hands on the rest... He shrugs, then turns, finds the coffee cup again. Ventur a sniff. Max is not amused.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then how can you be so sure of its value?

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: A guy tried to kill me for it. I figured that was a good indication. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Silver sips, then reacts. Not bad. Off Max--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazy and crowded. A dozen black Walrus sailors smoke PIPE and converse in another language. Gates enters, and the m GO QUIET. Glare up at him. Gates scans the crowd until he finds the man heвЂ™s looking for... He locks eyes with-- MOSIAH (50s). The clan elder here. Mosiah considers Gates beat, then signals his men to clear out. They do. Gates sits.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: I know you and your men gave your votes to Singleton.

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: He makes a good case.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: No he doesnвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: (smiles) No, he doesnвЂ™t. But it does appear he will be our new captain. That's not a man to have as an enemy...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not so sure about that. MosiahвЂ™s eyes narrow. Gates then nods toward an OBEAH S in the corner-- May I? Mosiah nods. Gates pulls two ceremonial PIPES from beside it, and packs them. Hands on Mosiah, and lights them. A gesture of respect, and itвЂ™s received well. They smoke together.

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The vote is closer than you think. I know this, because I bought back twenty-four votes today. (off MosiahвЂ™s surprise) NelsonвЂ™s men are always for sale. Paying Muldoon got me the Welsh and the gunners, thatвЂ™s 18 more votes. As of now, Singleton is up 8 votes, and you and your men hold nine. So--

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: The CaptainвЂ™s fate is in our hands. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Your hands, old priest. Your men will vote with you.

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: And how much are you willing to pay for our support?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Well... Nothing. I spent the last of what I had to get this far. Mosiah frowns. Addresses the shrine.

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: Forgive him, Yemaya. His mind is spoiled from old age.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: You're a wise man, Mosiah. Think about your men. WhatвЂ™s best for their future...

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: Is it their future you wish to protect... Or your friendвЂ™s?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: (beat) What difference does it make? Mosiah considers that. Nods. A pensive beat... MThen--

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: And you will pay us, obviously, from the very next prize we take--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: I assumed that went without saying.

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: (beat; considers) For me, your word is good enough. But for my men... They will need something more... Off Mosiah, the smallest of smiles, as strange guttural CHANTING builds, and WE SMASH CUT TO: MOMENTS LATER, CLOSE ON A LONG BLADE... AND REVEAL-- Mosi his men, and GATES, whose hand is held over the shrine, a the BLADE IS DRAWN ACROSS HIS PALM, blood dripping into i Gates winces. Mosiah looks down at him with a smile. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Off Gates... The things he does for Flint... But we then- WIDEN, to a distant POV of the same scene. Watching on is another PIRATE. 30s. Slight. Sitting on the beach by another encampment... Very interested in what heвЂ™s seei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singleton celebrates with a few men at a table. Raucus. As he crosses to the bar to get another drink--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re in a festive mood. Singleton sees the SLIGHT PIRATE we just saw spying on Ga SingletonвЂ™s smiles fades. Wary...

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: What do you want, Rackham? Meet вЂњCALICOвЂќ JACK RACKHAM. He smiles, all charm.

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM, (SLIGHT PIRATE)
dialogues.text: I want... to toast your coronation as Captain of the Walrus. (then; casually) Unfortunately, IвЂ™m not so sure thatвЂ™s where weвЂ™re headed... Off Singleton, wondering what the hell that means...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted stretch. Campfires and revelry in the distance Reveal Silver, alone, looking out at The Walrus anchored in the bay. A small CANOE near his feet. He turns as a FIGURE approaches in the dark. A PIRATE. As he steps into the light, we see itвЂ™s actually MAX, dres aman. Silver notes her outfit with a smile--

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Fetching. Max just curses in French, walks past him to the canoe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silver and Max paddle the canoe out into the harbor. Ahea the WALRUS looms... At this distance, we can just begin t hear A LONE FIDDLE PLAYING from her deck... As they draw closer, Max stares up at the ship, apprehens Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: If it wasnвЂ™t for Captain Flint, you'd still be a slave to that merchant captain. You stole from your own savior.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Well, the cook stole it from the prize. I stole it from the cook. Then you stole it from me, so we've all got some explaining to do.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You cannot tell the difference between the three?

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Not really, no. Max considers him. Intrigued... MOMENTS LATER... The canoe comes up along the WalrusвЂ™s Silver grabs a hold of a rope running alongside the hull.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If IвЂ™m not back soon--

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: IвЂ™l1l leave.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Smart girl... And with that, Silver starts CLIMBING UP THE SIDE OF THE WALRUS... The FIDDLE MUSIC getting louder as he goes... He reaches the TOP OF THE ROPE, but it doesnвЂ™t go up to deck. IT GOES INTO A PORTHOLE, too small to crawl through Silver spots ANOTHER ROPE a few feet away; that one goes the way up. But heвЂ™1ll have to jump to grab it... Silve looks down, instantly regrets it. ItвЂ™s a long fall. ON SILVER. He swings... LEAPS... And GRABS HOLD OF THE RO But the ROPE GROANS with his momentum, as it sways back a forth... On Silver, unable to stop it... And suddenly-- THE MUSIC STOPS. Silence. SHIT... Silver scrambles up, grabs the LIP BELOW THE RAILING just THE NIGHT WATCHMAN appears, looking out over the railing. Can't see Silver, who is-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 HANGING JUST BELOW HIM. SilverвЂ™s knuckles are white... losing his grip... Until-- The Watchman disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WATCHMAN resumes playing his fiddle. And in the deep background behind him, we see SILVER HAUL HIMSELF UP and the railing... And skulk silently away towards the stern. INT. WALRUS - CAPTAINвЂ™S CABIN - MOMENTS LATER Silver enters. And just as he shuts the door behind him--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Let me tell you a story about a Spaniard named Vazquez... --we INTERCUT WITH: INT. RICHARD GUTHRIEвЂ™S HOUSE - NIGHT Candlelit. Richard and Gates listen as Flint talks--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: A few weeks ago, he staggers into a Port Royal tavern, and sits next to an English Merchant Captain. Vazquez, it turns out, is dying. Bleeding from a knife wound to the belly. BACK TO THE WALRUS, where we see QUICK CUTS of Silver carefully looking through FlintвЂ™s things. Books. Scient instruments. AN EASEL, with a half-painted landscape in progress. In toto, a glimpse of a self-improving man. But no Merchant CaptainвЂ™s Log... Silver is getting frustrat

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The knife wound is courtesy of his former employer... But just as Silver is ready to give up, his FOOT CATCHES SOMETHING. A FLOORBOARD, raised just slightly at one corn

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: La Casa del ContraciГ©n, in Seville. SMASH BACK TO RICHARD, as his eyebrows go up.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Colonial intelligence... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: He was one of their top agents in the Americas. Charged with overseeing maritime operations. His specific task, for the past two years, was the management of a very special set of ships, delayed in Havana for extensive repairs... BACK TO SILVER, as he carefully pries up the floorboard. Underneath, Silver finds some papers. A few books. Among them, the MERCHANT CAPTAINвЂ™S LOG.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Delayed so long, that two shipments had been consolidated into one. Silver opens the log. Finds where his page was torn from.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Eight heavy cargo galleons. 12 escort ships, including 4 ships of the line... And as Silver reads, and his eyes go wide--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Treasure Fleet. (then) According to Vazquez, total cargo is in excess of 7 million dollars. On Silver. Shit-eating grin. But the momentвЂ™s broken wh He hears floorboards CREAKING-- The Watchman is coming. Startled, Silver ACCIDENTALLY RIPS A PAGE IN THE LOG... On Silver. Screwed. No escape out the door. No hiding the fact that he was here... Just as we CUT TO: THE WATCHMAN, opening FlintвЂ™s cabin door and seeing-- Nothing. SilverвЂ™s gone. The floorboard is where it belo No sign of anything wrong. Except for the OPEN WINDOW SHUTTERS, swinging in the breeze... The Watchman looks ou the window. Then LOOKS DOWN AT THE LEDGE... Nothing there either. The coast is clear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re on the waterвЂ™s surface, looking up at the windo FlintвЂ™s cabin, 50 feet above, as the Watchman closes th shutters and disappears. A silent, tranquil beat, before- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 SILVER SURFACES FROM THE WATER, SUCKING AIR-- And off the sounds of his heaving, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The calming sounds of the surf, lapping at the beach. Lit only by the moon. But then, we make out VOICES YELLING in the distance, as the CAMERA CRESTS the bluff to reveal--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You told me you and your men were with me... You fucked me... SINGLETON... in a heated argument with MOSIAH. WeвЂ™re eavesdropping on a meet. Behind Mosiah is LEVI, 6'6, 300+ heвЂ™s an ounce. One of his men, serving as his bodyguard

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: I do what is best for my family.

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: I'm what's best for your family. Flint has fucked us all for long enough...

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH
dialogues.text: (beat) You've had your say. And my mind is unchanged. Mosiah nods to Levi. Time to go. But as they turn to walk away, theyвЂ™re startled by TWO PIRATES STANDING IN THEIR One is Jack Rackham. The other is concealed in shadows... Mosiah turns to Singleton, who just smiles. ItвЂ™s an amb Levi steps towards Rackham and the other Pirate. Pulls a DAGGER. But as he moves towards them-- A SHOT RINGS OUT FROM THE DARKNESS. Mosiah recoils, as he SPATTERED BY LEVIвЂ™S BLOOD. Levi drops to one knee... And from a side path emerges a FEMALE PIRATE. 21. Kinda hot. But dead-eyed. She walks up to Levi, parries a desperate swipe of his dagger, and without any hesitation SLITS LEVIвЂ™S THROAT. He crumples in a heap. The woman stands over him. Watching him die. Taking it in. Somethin is very wrong with this lady. Meet ANNE BONNY. Then Mosiah sees the Pirate in the Shadows emerge. Recognizes him immediately...

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vane... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 CAPTAIN CHARLES VANE. Late 20s. Handsome, but for the sca running down his face. And mean... Mosiah then turns back to Singleton. Seethes at him.

dialogues.speaker: MOSIAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ukwa ru-oge ya, odaa... --and SPITS at his feet. Then turns back to Vane. And off his defiant look, we SMASH TO-- MOMENTS LATER, Vane, Rackham and Singleton walk off into night. TRACK THROUGH them, as Vane addresses Singleton--

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Captain. CONTINUE TRACKING PAST THEM, past Bonny, trailing a step behind, wiping blood from her blade... And CONTINUE TRACKING... Back up the path... Past LeviвЂ™s corpse... A past MOSIAHвЂ™s body, in a pool of blood... To the tip of MOSIAHвЂ™S FINGER... As it twitches... And begins to draw line in the sand...

dialogues.speaker: END ACT TWO
dialogues.text: Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: ACT THREE
dialogues.text: INT. RICHARD GUTHRIEвЂ™S HOUSE - NIGHT Back with Richard, Flint and Billy. Flint continues his account-вЂ”

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Before his death, Vazquez was given a direct order to launch the fleet. But he knew it was unprepared. When he said heвЂ™d take his case to the King, his bosses decided to silence him. (then) But that fleet is sailing. And I mean to meet them along the way...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How do you know all of this?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: The Merchant Captain...? His name is Parrish. IвЂ™ve been chasing him for a month now. And yesterday, I found him. Along with VazquezвЂ™s story, neatly written into his log. Billy's jaw is on the floor. CanвЂ™t believe what heвЂ™s But the look on RichardвЂ™s face is different... Amused..

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: A man whispers his dying words on an island hundreds of miles from here. His secret boards a ship, one of hundreds sailing these waters... and in a manner of weeks, you've found it...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Well... Most of it. A page was torn from the log, with the fleet's course and schedule. I could recreate it from whatвЂ™s left, but I would need help. Someone with knowledge of Spanish operations... (then) Your man in Havana. I need you to make an introduction.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: And what makes you think I would even consider doing that? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Billy looks to Flint, expecting a reaction. None so far..

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: 7 million dollars. When I take that fleet, you stand to gain--

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: When you take the fleet? You are talking about the most heavily guarded cargo in the history of civilization--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: The risk is all mine--

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: --the risk is not all yours. What do you think Seville would do if they thought we were conspiring to steal state secrets? What do you think an English magistrate would do if he knew I actively supported one of your exploits-- Richard trails off as he feels something cold against his neck... FLINTвЂ™S BLADE... Richard's eyes go wide--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Let me make myself plain. I/'11 have that name. Or Billy and I will have your fingers.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: (beat) Fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: (beat; okay then) Billy, would you put your pistol on Mr. Guthrie here... The CLICK of a pistol cocking, O.S. But when Flint turns, sees BILLYвЂ™S PISTOL IS AIMED AT HIM.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Sir-- Mr. Gates said-- AND IN A FLASH, FLINT REACHES-- SNATCHES BILLYвЂ™S PISTOL HIS HAND-- And before Billy knows what happened, Flint ha the PISTOL POINTED BACK AT BILLY. A beat. Billy waiting for Flint to pull the trigger. But Flint does something unexpected... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 HE HANDS THE PISTOL BACK TO BILLY. He then guides the muz of it down towards RichardвЂ™s head. On Billy, his head spinning... Flint returns to Richard. Moves his sword to his pinky...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: The name. Please. On Richard. Sweating. A tense beat... But itвЂ™s broken b

dialogues.speaker: SERVANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Guthrie. You're needed outside. It's quite urgent. The doorknob RATTLES. Flint nods to Billy, who peers out nearest window... then turns back to Flint with an oh shi look... Off Flint, SMASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER, AS THE DOOR SWINGS OPEN, REVEALING--
dialogues.text: Richard's SERVANT, as he leads in AN ENGLISH NAVAL CAPTAI (HUME, 40s, gruff), his LIEUTENANT, and TWO MARINES. REVERSE ON -- Flint and Richard seated, Billy nearby, as though everything is fine. SERVANT (CONTвЂ™D) Captain Thomas Hume, of His MajestyвЂ™s Ship, the Scarborough. NEW ANGLE -- and we see FLINT HOLDING THE PISTOL under th table, aimed at Richard... Off this tension--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Gates, at the bar, as Guthrie pours him a stiff drin She clocks the BANDAGE around his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Do I even want to know?

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Just know IвЂ™m up one vote. Your money spends well. Guthrie nods. Good. But as she turns to go--

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The question now is why you spent it. Guthrie turns back to meet his suspicious gaze. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see I happen to agree with Mr. Scott... IвЂ™m a terrible investment. And you were awfully quick to open your purse... (beat) Just what do you think you bought with that money, Ms. Guthrie? On Guthrie. Beat. Weighing whether to come clean. Then--

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: I want you to sink the Scarborough.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: (beat; to Scott) Sorry, I was just a few feet from a twelve-pounder misfire when I sailed with Captain Avery, this ear hasn't been right since... It sounded like she just asked me to attack the Scarborough... Scott doesnвЂ™t answer. But itвЂ™s clear heвЂ™s just as t it as Gates...

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s a threat to our business--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Forgive me, but our business is thieving. Soft targets, big cargos. Attacking heavily armed ships-of-the-line... That ainвЂ™t it. Guthrie seethes. She hates being spoken to like a child. Gates can see that, proceeds carefully--

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: MaвЂ™am. We canвЂ™t sink the Scarborough. LetвЂ™s be clear about that. But even if we could, it wouldnвЂ™t matter. England would just send another like her--

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t know that.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Yes. I do. And when that day comes, there is only one course of action. We get on our boats, and-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t have a boat, Mr. Gates. Gates quiets, startled by her conviction--

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What I do have is this saloon, an inn, and a few acres of land that might one day be a farm. It may not be much, but it is mine. I built it, and IвЂ™ve bled for it. And unlike you, IвЂ™m not so ready to turn my back on it just yet. (then) Now you may not like that, but IвЂ™m not so certain I care. If FlintвЂ™s still a captain tomorrow, itвЂ™s because of me, and yes... I do intend to cash that chit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Gates, realizing heвЂ™s got a real problem on his hand

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Gates! Gates and Guthrie turn to see Logan in the doorway, a gra look on his face... Off Gates-- INT. RICHARD GUTHRIEвЂ™S HOUSE - HARBOUR ISLAND - NIGHT Back with Flint, Billy, Richard... And CAPTAIN HUME.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Captain Hume... Welcome to Harbour Island. My name is--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HUME
dialogues.text: I know who you are, Mr. Guthrie. (re: Flint and Gates) These men, I do not know.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Sugar merchants, Captain. They were just leaving, actually... Hume steps closer to Flint. Eye-fucking him, severely.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HUME
dialogues.text: Sugar merchants... (beat) Mr. Guthrie, tell me something. Do you have gossip here? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Beg pardon?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HUME
dialogues.text: Gossip. IвЂ™ve often wondered if it can survive in so remote a location. (then) Gossip is what holds civilization together. It reinforces shame. And without shame... Well... The world is a very dangerous place.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry, but I donвЂ™t understand--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HUME
dialogues.text: Do you know what the gossip in London is about you? (beat; uh-oh...) The gossip is that you make your profits selling ill-gotten cargo. Stolen by the Pirates of New Providence Island... That hangs in the air. A tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s no truth to that.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN HUME
dialogues.text: We'll find out, wonвЂ™t we? (to Lieutenant) Take them into custody. All of them. Flint and Billy share a quick look... Then-- BOOM! FLINTвЂ™S PISTOL FIRES, shattering the wood table, WINGING ONE OF THE MARINES... Flint and Billy swing into action-- FLINT ENGAGING THE LIEUTENANT IN A SWORD FIGHT-- QUICK... BRUTAL... WITH BILLY, as he fights off one of the Marines... he loo out the window and sees-- MORE MARINES, heading up to the house... BACK WITH FLINT, as he dispatches the Lieutenant... Then looks up, and sees Richard being hustled out of the room Hume and the other Marine-- Flint chases them out into-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but as he rounds the corner, he sees ahead-- THE REINFORCEMENTS. A half dozen Marines, several of them readying MUSKETS TO FIRE AT FLINT. ON FLINT. Just a momentвЂ™s hesitation, before he starts RUN RIGHT AT THE MARINES... But he only gets a few steps before-- BILLY CORRALS HIM, shoving him into a wall... And just be the Marines are about to fire at us, BILLY HURLS A GAS LA The Corridor IGNITES IN FLAMES... Flint watches Richard hurried away, a wall of fire separating them... Billy pulls Flint towards the back door... And off Flint, out of options...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flint and Billy clear the grounds of the house, the beach visible ahead. But Flint stops. Turns to see RICHARD, bei hauled away in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: No-- He starts to head that way, but Billy blocks him.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Sir, itвЂ™s too late--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I need that name--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What difference does it make if you're dead?! Flint is furious. But canвЂ™t quite argue. And off the so of SOLDIERS yelling orders, getting closer, we SMASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie SILENCE. An oar breaks the waterвЂ™s surface, as we UP to see Billy, rowing away from Harbour Island on a ski CAMERA pans off him to reveal Flint, in the back, also rowing, but glaring at Billy. Not happy. As they near an OUTCROPPING of trees--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Oars up. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Billy obeys, ducks low, as their momentum takes them out past... THE SCARBOROUGH... anchored in the harbour. Startlingly close. Twice the size of the Walrus. So many fucking guns As their skiff floats silently past... even Flint canвЂ™t but gape. And off the Scarborough, its lamps glittering, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSIAHвЂ™S OPEN, LIFELESS EYES. Torchlight flickering in WIDEN, as Gates, Guthrie, Scott and Logan arrive. Dr. How is inspecting Mosiah and Levi's bodies. Others from the Walrus crew watch on, stunned. The Jamaicans mourn. Howell then draws GatesвЂ™s attention to the sand beside MosiahвЂ™s hand. Some letters scrawled in it. V-A-N... Th blood from MosiahвЂ™s wounds has run into the letters, fi them red...

dialogues.speaker: HOWELL
dialogues.text: Goddamned butcher, Vane is...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s always been a butcher. But apparently heвЂ™s gone and gotten clever, too. Gates looks up, sees SINGLETON AMONG THE ONLOOKERS. Gates burns. Singleton just watches on evenly. Was that a hint a grin? Singleton then turns, and walks off. We then find GUTHRIE, as she storms off into the night alone.

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: MaвЂ™ am-- But she just holds up a hand behind her. Don't follow... Off Gates and Scott, watching her disappear into the nigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nastiest, most decadent corner of the inn, because it where Vane puts his feet up. All around, CREW MEMBERS gamble, drink, get HANDJOBS. Sometimes all at once. Amid the debauchery, Rackham sits at a small DESK, writin on a strip of PARCHMENT. Bonny watches over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BONNY
dialogues.text: What is that? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM
dialogues.text: Terms. For the consortship of the Walrus. Singleton will run her, but heвЂ™1l run her in our service. He continues writing. Bonny eyes the paper suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: BONNY
dialogues.text: The Captain should give you that ship.

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM
dialogues.text: (beat; smiles...) All in good time. Suddenly, the room QUIETS. Vane turns to see Guthrie ente All eyes on her, as she heads straight for Vane--

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: Ms. Guthrie-- BAM. Guthrie clocks him. OOOHHHHS from around the room... Vane shakes it off, looks back at Guthrie. Then... PUNCHE HER JUST AS HARD. Guthrie flops to the floor, amid CHEERS and JEERS from the assembled. Guthrie tries to pick herself up, as Vane steps forward.. And just when we think sheвЂ™1ll get a foot to the ribs.. Vane offers her his hand. A beat, and she takes it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guthrie enters in a huff, as Vane calmly shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: Come here. He goes to her, takes her face in his hands to inspect he jaw, which is already swelling purple. She tries to pull away, but his grip is too tight... She winces...

dialogues.speaker: VANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now would you like to tell me what that was all about?

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: You fucked me tonight. (off VaneвЂ™s confusion) Flint. His captaincy. I had an interest... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: What interest could you possibly have in something like that? (re: her cheek) You'll live. She pulls away from him. Tries to regain control.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: You will make this right. Convince Singleton not to call the vote.

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Because if you donвЂ™t, youвЂ™re finished here. I won't sell another ounce of your cargo.

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: Eleanor... Your father sells my cargo. And whatever it is youвЂ™re so upset about, I doubt he feels the same.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: When I tell him you put our biggest earner out of business, heвЂ™11--

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: --remind you that Flint hasnвЂ™t been your biggest earner in quite some time. I have. (then) And you'll also be reminded of what you've always known and never accepted, which is that if forced, your father will always choose profits over daughters. She burns at him. But he approaches her. Pushes the hair from her face.

dialogues.speaker: VANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hate your father. I wouldnвЂ™t blame you. Hate me too if you'd like. And if you feel the need, cling to Flint and his legend and a past the rest of us have long outgrown. But make no mistake about it... Whatever future this place has left, IвЂ™m it. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 His hand then moves to her swollen jaw. Caresses it.

dialogues.speaker: VANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if you ever challenge me again in front of my crew, I might just forget that I loved you once. off Guthrie, ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silver sits alone, nursing a drink. He looks up as Max approaches, sits in his lap. As she pretends to flirt--

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What we have to sell... They are very much interested... The two of them share a smile. Dollar signs in their eyes

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The parlay is set. I will meet the buyer tomorrow to set terms and price.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Tomorrow? Why not tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: This buyer... One does not want to meet when itвЂ™s dark... Silver nods, got it. At that moment, Max spots Guthrie entering from the back room. She crosses to the bar, grab bottle, pours a shot and slams it back.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Silver watches as Max crosses the room toward Guthrie. Sh arrives, just as Guthrie goes to pour another drink. Befo she can, Max snatches the glass, puts it behind the bar. Guthrie glares at Max. Is she serious? Guthrie reaches fo another glass, and this time Max grabs the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: What do you think youвЂ™re doing? Max doesnвЂ™t answer. Instead, she takes a bottle, turns, begins climbing the staircase. On Guthrie, watching her g Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guthrie enters, and Max shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Sur le lit, sвЂ™il vous plait. Guthrie sits on the bed, as Max crosses to a VANITY, star lighting candles. Guthrie notices her whiskey bottle, pou out into a CHAMBERPOT.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: That was a waste, donвЂ™t you think? Max's back is to Guthrie. She lights the last candle.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I thought we had agreed. When the sea grows rough... you come to Max. Now Max turns around... and as she does she unbuttons her dress, lets it fall to the floor, revealing her nude body She then crosses to Guthrie, spreads her legs and kneels between them.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Max is your harbor. Max runs her hands up GuthrieвЂ™s thighs, and Guthrie sti Max continues to caress her... until finally, GuthrieвЂ™s exterior falls away, and we see the young woman behind it Vulnerable. Even scared. Momentarily overwhelmed, she gri Max's face with both hands--

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s over, Max... This place-- itвЂ™s going away... And I canвЂ™t stop it...

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No. She leans back, smiling, shoots a look up to the sky--

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you. He is watching. At the word вЂњHe,вЂќ Guthrie tries to pull away, but Max let her.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He answered my prayers today. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Guthrie can see from Max's smile that sheвЂ™s being serio But before she can ask a question, Max puts a finger to h lips. SheвЂ™s done talking. Instead, she inches her other hand up GuthrieвЂ™s skirt. Guthrie reacts... Well, appreciatively. As she leans backward onto the bed... giving in...

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe soon... he will answer yours. Off Guthrie, in ecstasy, as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Flint, in CLOSE UP. Unreadable, staring out at... NEW PROVIDENCE... Against the brilliant orange and pinks dawn, it draws nearer. The harbour mouth almost visible..

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think you're weak. Flint turns to Billy. The first words spoken in hours.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just donвЂ™t trust you. Because I have no idea what it is you want... Flint absorbs that, but still doesnвЂ™t feel obligated to respond. BillyвЂ™s frustrated now--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you had chased Mr. Guthrie, you would be dead. Yet youвЂ™re angry with me for stopping you? You're willing to die to chase an impossibility. What am I to take from that?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: (beat) Do you read?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (beat) You mean... books?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Odysseus, on his way home to Ithaka, is visited by a ghost. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The ghost tells him that once he reaches his home, once he kills all his enemies and sets his house in order, he must do one last thing before he can rest... (then) The ghost says he must pick up an oar, and walk inland. And keep walking until someone mistakes that oar for a shovel. For that would be a place where no man had ever been troubled by the sea. And thatвЂ™s where heвЂ™d find peace. On Billy. Captivated.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When this is all said and done, IвЂ™d like to think there'll be a place where I can find a little peace. At this point... ThatвЂ™s all I want. Off Flint. For the first time since weвЂ™ve met him, he appears just a little bit vulnerable... Off Billy, not qu sure what to make of that... MINUTES LATER, the Skiff rounds into the bay, REVEALING-- THE ENTIRE ISLAND, waiting for them. Silent. ON THE BEACH, hundreds of Pirates, watching. TIGHT ON GUTHRIE AND SCOTT, among the crowd... ON VANEвЂ™S SHIP (The Ranger), their entire crew assemble TIGHT ON VANE, RACKHAM and BONNY... Vane barely conceals small smile as he anticipates victory... ON THE WALRUS, Singleton standing at the head of the crew though heвЂ™s captain already... Gates behind him... BACK ON THE SKIFF... Flint and Billy, feeling the weight a thousands sets of eyes on them... And off Flint--

dialogues.speaker: END ACT THREE
dialogues.text: Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flint and Billy come aboard the Walrus. Singleton steps forward. Stands toe-to-toe with Flint for a beat, before turning to--

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: Mr. Quartermaster. I want an immediate vote to determine the rightful captain of this ship. On Gates, as Flint looks over his way. Gates reads the disappointment in FlintвЂ™s eyes, and itвЂ™s devastating

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: A minute, please... A beat, and Gates nods. Flint heads to his cabin, doesnвЂ bother looking back. Off Gates, hating every minute of this...
