And elsewhere among the crew, we find-- SILVER. Watching it all with great interest... INT. FLINTвЂ™S CABIN - SAME Flint enters, slams the door behind him. HeвЂ™s coiled. Angry. He looks over at the EASEL in the corner... MOMENTS LATER, A MATCH IS STRUCK... Flint sits before the canvas, and we get a good look at it. It depicts a large field of grass sloping upward into a hill. Somewhere amid the expanse, there is lone FIGURE, silhouetted in black. back is to us, but over his shoulder, he carries an OAR. beat, as Flint stares at it, the flame of the match advan toward his fingers. Flint wants to burn the painting, but heвЂ™s caught up in the image. The dream of it... Still powerful enough to give him pause. CLOSE ON -- His thumb, as the flame reaches FlintвЂ™s thu He reacts, pinching out the flame, and dropping the match the floor. Flint stoops down to pick up the match... and STOPS. FLINTвЂ™S POV - THE FLOORBOARD... Hiding his secret compartment. ItвЂ™s loose. Flint reacts. Holy shit. QUICK CUTS, as he pulls up the floorboard, removes the Merchant CaptainвЂ™s log, flips t the pages, then stops... His eyes growing wide... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 CLOSE ON the TORN PAGE that SILVER RIPPED IN HASTE earlie Suddenly FlintвЂ™s despair changes to something else... H got an idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flint emerges from his cabin. Makes the long walk to rejo Gates, Singleton, et al... All eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: I want to say something. Singleton looks around. The crew is watching. CanвЂ™t rea justify muzzling Flint... Singleton steps back. Flint looks out at the crew. A beat. Then--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry. GatesвЂ™s eyebrows go up. ThatвЂ™s the last thing he expe

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For the short hauls. For the trouble IвЂ™ve caused. Most importantly, for the disregard it seems IвЂ™ve shown you. On Gates. Then Billy. Both wondering where this is going.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not long ago I stood in Mr. SingletonвЂ™s shoes, and led the charge to remove a tyrant captain. I knew then and I know now, that a ship is doomed to fail if it lacks trust between Captain and crew. Mutual trust... Flint then pulls the MERCHANT CAPTAINвЂ™S LOG from his co Doesn't say what it is yet. Fidgets with it conspicuously On Silver... Uh-oh...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For the last few months, you and I have been on the trail of a prize so big, I felt it necessary to keep it secret. Even from you. The good news is, that prize is now within our grasp. The bad news is, my concerns about secrecy seem to have been well-founded... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Flint opens the captainвЂ™s log, to the TORN-OUT PAGE...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Someone on this boat discovered my plan. They tore from this log the very page necessary to capture the prize. Stole it, for their own gain. Stole it from us. ON SILVER, in the crowd. Starting to sweat, as Flint slow walks out towards the crew... Towards him...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then stoked your resentment to cover the crime... Flint then turns. HeвЂ™s now looking at SINGLETON.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--and make himself your captain. On Singleton, confused, as we GO TO: THE RANGER. Where Vane watches from the main deck....

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing? ON THE BEACH, Guthrie and Scott also watch intently. BACK ON THE WALRUS... Singleton responds to the accusatio

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: This is absurd. I donвЂ™t know what heвЂ™s talking about! The crews attention now turns to Gates. He steps forward, shooting Flint a loaded look--

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: That's a very serious accusation, Captain. Thievery is punishable by death. As is a false accusation. Flint just glares at him. Dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then per the articles, the accused has a choice. He can submit to a trial--

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: With who as judge? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Me. Your quartermaster.

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: (beat; sneers) No. (then) No fucking way. Gates shoots a look back at Flint. You figured this...

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: Or duel... Singleton glares at him, considering. Finally--

dialogues.speaker: SINGLETON
dialogues.text: Maybe this is better. Be rid of you once and for all. Flint responds with a nod. PULLS HIS SWORD. Singleton pulls his sword... And-- THE DUEL BEGINS. A brutal, close-quarters sword fight. Messy and mean. FlintвЂ™s agility vs. SingletonвЂ™s brute strength. As the swords CLASH and SING, the crew watches, rapt... ON GATES, doing everything he can not to intervene, as SingletonвЂ™s strength threatens to overwhelm Flint... ON THE BEACH... Guthrie looks from the Walrus over to Van ship, sitting opposite it in the bay. ON THE RANGER... Rackham steps up behind Vane--

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM
dialogues.text: What if Singleton loses?

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: He won't... This, as Flint FALLS TO THE DECK, losing his sword. He ro away just as SingletonвЂ™s sword strikes the wood. It loo like curtains for the Captain, until-- Flint pulls a DAGGER, slices SingletonвЂ™s ankle. Singlet buckles, giving Flint an opening. Flint slams him in the face, and Singleton falls to his back... Flints on him in time... PUMMELING the brute with both fists. Vane can sense the tide turning... he turns to Rackham. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: VANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Load the starboard guns. Rackham nods... as WE GO: TO THE BEACH, WITH GUTHRIE, watching as VaneвЂ™s crew spr to action. That can't be good. She looks from the Ranger, back to the Walrus. Realizes FlintвЂ™s ship is a sitting for VaneвЂ™s cannons. And she has to do something...

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott! Scott approaches, as Guthrie leans in, whispers something him. Scott looks at her like sheвЂ™s mad. But her look sa she means business. As Scott trots off, we GO BACK TO: THE WALRUS... Where the fight enters its final, brutal st With SingletonвЂ™s hand clawing desperately for his throa Flint continues to hammer down with his fists. Again. And again... turning SingletonвЂ™s face to pulp. The crew wat stunned and sickened, as... Singleton stops moving. ItвЂ™ over. Flint staggers to his feet, immediately begins searching dead manвЂ™s pockets, as the crew closes in... What's he Flint PRODUCES A FOLDED PIECE OF PAPER... Holds it up for the crew to see. ON SILVER... Completely thrown. Instinctively checks his pocket to make sure he still has the map... He does. So what the fuck does Flint have? BACK TO FLINT, chest-heaving, holding the paper.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Billy... Billy looks up, surprised. Flint staggers toward him, holding the page out with a BLOODIED HAND.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The crew has your trust. (beat) Is this the stolen page? Billy stares at Flint, hesitant. Knows thereвЂ™s somethin deliberate about this, but heвЂ™s compelled to go along. a beat, he takes the paper, unfolds it and sees-- ITвЂ™S BLANK. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Billy looks up, sees Flint staring back. A silent message Are you with me...? Billy is frozen. He holds the captainвЂ™s fate in his han We stay on his face for a VERY LONG TIME, before--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: It is. The crew reacts, stunned... Too stunned, in fact, to see- The Ranger's starboard CANNONS appearing out of the gun wells, one by one. On board, the gunners signal the runner... we're ready... BACK ON THE WALRUS... Flint seizes the moment--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: This prize wonвЂ™t come easy... It will be defended like nothing you or I have ever seen... But whatвЂ™s ever come easy to us? The crew is getting into it. Nodding heads...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can think of no other ship, no other crew, IвЂ™d rather have with me when I take it. The crew, now smiling... HeвЂ™s got them... And in that moment-вЂ” BACK ON THE RANGER, Rackham receives a message--

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM
dialogues.text: Starboard batteries at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: Fire. A DISTANT SOUND OF CANNONFIRE... Vane cocks an ear-- Thos arenвЂ™t his guns... Where did that--? CRRRACK!!! CANNONFIRE STRIKES VANEвЂ™S MASTS AND SAILS... As his crew dives for cover, Vane looks up and sees... th SMOKING GUNS of the old fort, on the bluff above the Walr PAN DOWN to the beach, where Guthrie stands alone, facing toward Vane. As VaneвЂ™s eyes catch her, Guthrie smiles a him, then raises her hand above her head... as WE CUT TO: Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POV of Guthrie, looking down on her from above. As her hand goes up... REVEAL SCOTT... Supervising a group of GuthrieвЂ™s SLAVES acting as a makeshift gun crew. Off her signal-- scott Fire again. The slaves light the flint, and-- KABOOM... MORE CANNONFIRE riddles the Ranger... SPLINTERI VaneвЂ™s rigging and strewing the deck with falling debri

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM
dialogues.text: She'll sink us if we let her... As the crew races to get the ship going, we stay on Vane, refusing to duck or move. As debris falls around him, he glares down at Guthrie with violent hatred. On the beach, she looks back. Shoots him the middle finge MOMENTS LATER... The Ranger retreats out of the bay. ON FLINT. He turns, trades a look with Gates, as we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HARBOR BARGE arrives, carrying Flint. He disembarks, wa right up to a stunned Guthrie, then turns to follow her l out toward VaneвЂ™s retreating ship...

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: What the fuck did I just do? off Flint, has to smile--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy sits alone, still in shock over what happened.

dialogues.speaker: GATES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It was blank, wasnвЂ™t it? REVEAL Gates, in the doorway behind him. Billy just stare at him for a beat. Speechless. Having got his answer, Gates turns to go--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: How did he know I'd go along? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Gates stops, turns back. Thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: What makes you think he knew? Off Billy, mind blown-- INT. GUTHRIEвЂ™S OFFICE - LATER With Flint, Guthrie and Scott.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Your fatherвЂ™s been arrested. On Guthrie. Stunned. She shares a shocked look with Scott

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Arrested? By who?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Captain Hume, of the HMS Scarborough. GuthrieвЂ™s mind races a mile a minute. Flint continues--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need your assurance you can keep this operation going in his absence. We sail soon for our next prize and my needs are substantial. Guthrie snaps back to reality. Your needs?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be outfitting more than one ship, which will exhaust your powder and grain stores, so you'll want to send for more right away. And to answer your question... no, I canвЂ™t pay for any of it. (then) Think of it as a loan. Guthrie takes a beat. The nerve on this guy.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: You know what? Fuck your needs. I need something from you first--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: The Scarborough? Guthrie reacts. He knows. Flint studies her for a beat-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 On Flint.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s assume for a moment that I could chase her off. How long before His Majesty, feeling bruised, decides to sends another ship? Or two. Or three. A few months, if weвЂ™re lucky. And when they arrived, we'd be sitting ducks.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: So what would be the point?

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: (beat) It'd be a few months. A beat. Until a smile grows on his face. Something telling him heвЂ™s found a kindred spirit...

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: You're going to help me--

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: Wait just a minute--

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not leaving this place.

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not leaving New Providence. IвЂ™m staying here. For good. (then) The fort is the first priority. Right now we have 6 guns. WeвЂ™1l need a hundred to defend that bay and mean it. Then we build a fleet. Frigates, with men trained to sail them. Once thatвЂ™s done, we'll build the farms. Half growing crops. The other half livestock. In a few years time, we can feed ourselves. WeвЂ™ll trade in the open. WeвЂ™1ll raise children. And when the day comes when England finally turn her guns on us, we'll be ready. And we will put up a hell of a fight. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 On Guthrie. Taking that in. Her mind is reeling...

dialogues.speaker: GUTHRIE
dialogues.text: (practically breathless) How? Flint smiles. HeвЂ™s got her.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Let me tell you a story about a Spaniard named Vazquez... And off Flint, we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small encampment, on the other side of the island from Nassau. Wild, overgrown. The Ranger is up on the beach, CAREENED against the hulk an old wreck. As the crew works to repair her, we find-- VANE, sitting by a small bonfire. Alone. Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s someone here to see you...

dialogues.speaker: VANE
dialogues.text: (beat) No.

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM
dialogues.text: I think youвЂ™1l want to hear what she has to say... Finally Vane looks up, and sees Rackham is standing with-

dialogues.speaker: RACKHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She has something she wants to sell you... And off the crackling flames... The soon-to-be-repaired Ranger... And Vane, down but not out... we SMASH TO BLACK
